body.p: You can use background images to impose a texture. You can use them to decorate an entire page, or a specific element from your document.

section.title: Page Background Images
section.p: You can set a background for a page. Usually, you do this for the cover page to impose a full-page artwork, or to add graphics to the header and footer of the page. Here is an example of how can you do it for the page:

p.note: It is better to use SVG for the page artworks. It does not suffer from pixelation. If you are limited to using raster images, you can fine-tune their resolution by using the image-resolution property.

section.p: If your artwork is smaller, consider a "DRAFT" watermark (for instance). You should use the background-position to place it where you need:
